No. 8458} Sub Applicability of Goods & Service Tax (GST) on the Fees to the Members of Conciliation Committees of Independent Experts Reg: In view of decision of the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) and provisions contained in the Arbitration and Conciliation Act 1996, National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) vide Policy Circular No. 2.1.23/2017 dated 02.06.2017 had constituted Settlement Committees of Independent Experts to undertake conciliation of commercial disputes between NHAI and its Concessionaires/ Contractors/Consultants. 2  The issue of applicability of Goods & Service Tax (GST) on the fees being paid to the members of the above conciliation committees was examined and it was observed that the Conciliator's services stand exempted from GST vide Gazette Notification issued by Ministry of Finance (Department of Revenue) No. 12/2017- Central Tax (Rate) vide GSR No. 691(E) dated 28th June, 2017 in case constitution/ 'appointment of conciliation committee is made as per Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. Hence, no GST is payable on the services of the members of Conciliation Committees appointed by NHAI. 3_ This issues with the approval of Competent Authority.
